contentencoded:
Two dozen U.S. military weapons systems have been compromised by Chinese hackers, according to the Washington Post. The newspaper cites a report prepared by the Defense Science Board, which suggests large amounts of data -- everything from combat vehicles to missile defense systems -- may now be in the hands of hackers.

Anup Ghosh, founder of the cybersecurity firm Invincia, joins Marketplace Tech host to explain.
